Wisdom: أَحْسِنُوا تِلَاوَةَ الْقُرْآنِ فَإِنَّهُ أَنْفَعُ الْقَصَصِ وَاسْتَشْفُوا بِهِ فَإِنَّهُ شِفَاءُ الصُّدُورِ
enWisdom: Excel in your recitation of the Qur’an, for it is indeed the most beneficial (or the best) of stories, and seek cure from it, for it is the cure for [what is in] the breasts

Wisdom: تَعَلَّمُوا الْقُرْآنَ فَإِنَّهُ رَبِيعُ الْقُلُوبِ وَاسْتَشْفُوا بِنُورِهِ فَإِنَّهُ شِفَاءُ الصُّدُورِ
enWisdom: Learn the Qur’an, for it is indeed the spring of the hearts and seek a cure from its light, for verily it is the cure of the hearts
The conception of faith is [achieved through] the recitation of the Qur’an

Wisdom: مَنْ أَنِسَ بِتِلَاوَةِ الْقُرْآنِ لَمْ تُوحِشْهُ مُفَارَقَةُ الْإِخْوَانِ
enWisdom: One who feels at ease with the recitation of the Qur’an does not become lonely by the separation of his brothers
